title: 113_hr4173
content: The Act is titled the "Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing Act of 2014". It establishes the Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing Program. The Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing program, established by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, guarantees loans for brownfield redevelopment and urban renewal projects. Eligibility requires submission of an application to the Secretary. Eligibility for a loan guarantee under the Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing program requires submission of a master plan meeting specific requirements, certification of environmental remediation need, and any additional information requested by the Secretary. The Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing program requires a master plan meeting specific requirements, certification of environmental remediation need, and additional information as requested by the Secretary for loan eligibility. The loan must be used for redevelopment projects such as acquiring brownfield sites, remediation, relocating existing facilities, or site preparation. The Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing program promotes urban renewal by acquiring and remediating brownfield sites, relocating existing facilities, and preparing sites with utilities and transportation facilities. Agencies responsible for contaminating brownfields are not eligible for loan guarantees under the program. The Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing program prohibits agencies responsible for contaminating brownfields from receiving loan guarantees for redevelopment projects. Additionally, a local government or redevelopment project cannot have more than one outstanding loan guaranteed under the Program, with a minimum loan amount of $25,000,000. The loan amount must be between $25,000,000 and $150,000,000. The interest rate is negotiated between the lender and borrower. The loan term is between 20 to 30 years. Repayment is not required. The loan term ranges from 20 to 30 years. Repayment of principal or interest is not required for the first 10 years, and repayment must start within 15 years. A master plan for the brownfield redevelopment project is required for the loan guarantee. The loan term for the brownfield redevelopment project ranges from 20 to 30 years, with repayment starting within 15 years. A master plan describing the project and budget is required for the loan guarantee. The project will lead to significant redevelopment in the community, focusing on economic development, environmental quality, and restoration. Key details include non-Federal funds commitment, long-term job creation, brownfield site remediation, environmental and economic impact assessment, affordable housing creation, reduction of vehicle congestion and emissions, and integration of green technology. The project's impact on the community includes the creation of affordable housing, reduction of vehicle congestion and emissions, integration of green technology, improvement in air quality, and incorporation of complete streets planning and transit-oriented development. Additionally, evidence of non-Federal investment commitments through zoning or other documentation, and an approved remediation action plan are required. The Secretary will establish selection criteria for local governments, redevelopment agencies, and BRAC projects to receive loan guarantees. Projects with existing Federal assistance will be given favorable consideration. The full faith and credit of the United States is pledged to guarantee payments under this section, ensuring the eligibility and validity of obligations. The Federal Government is protected from liability for environmental remediation. The Federal Government guarantees payments under this section, ensuring the validity of obligations. It is protected from liability for environmental remediation. The Secretary processes loan guarantee requests using an approval process similar to that of section 108 of the Housing and Community Development Act. The Secretary processes loan guarantee requests under this section similarly to section 108 of the Housing and Community Development Act, requiring a viable repayment schedule and sufficient collateral for approval. The Secretary processes loan guarantee requests under this section similarly to section 108 of the Housing and Community Development Act, requiring sufficient collateral for approval. Before final approval, Congressional oversight is necessary. Definitions for this section are provided. The Secretary notifies relevant Congressional committees of loan guarantee approvals. Definitions for "BRAC redevelopment project" and "brownfield" are provided. The Secretary of Defense notifies Congressional committees of loan guarantee approvals for BRAC redevelopment projects. Definitions for "brownfield" and "local redevelopment agency" are provided. A "remediation action plan" outlines how a brownfield redevelopment project site will be remediated. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will issue regulations for the Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing program within 6 months of enactment. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the program. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will issue regulations for the Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing program within 6 months of enactment. $100,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated for fiscal year 2015 for loans guaranteed under this section.
